Taxpayers in disaster-affected areas receive automatic extensions to file returns and make payments. For example, individuals and businesses impacted by recent disasters have until May 1 or October 15 to file returns and make payments without accruing fees or interest.

Victims may qualify for casualty loss deductions for property damage, lost income, or uninsured losses. These deductions can be claimed using IRS Form 4684 and may be applied to the current or previous tax year.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ admin_label=”Row 2″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”-30px||||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding=”||50px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Documentation” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||divi||400″ image_icon_width=”45px” admin_label=”Blurb: Documentation ” _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ body_link_font=”|600|||on||||dotted” text_orientation=”center” custom_css_main_element=”text-underline-offset: 4px;” global_colors_info=”{}”]

To support disaster claims, it’s important to save photos and videos of damaged property, receipts related to repairs, and original purchase records. To find the forms required for documenting losses in the event of a disaster, visit the Publication 584 resource page on the IRS website.

To find out if your home or business is an area that qualifies for disaster-related tax relief, visit the IRS’s official “Around the Nation” disaster relief page. There you’ll find the IRS’s comprehensive list of all disaster areas in the U.S. along with details that explain the specific tax relief available for each disaster area.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”Section 2: Disaster Preparation Tips for Taxpayers and Businesses” _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#0C71C3″ use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”#1c50a4 0%|#0c71c3 100%” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row admin_label=”Row 1″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||40px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Disaster Preparation Tips for Taxpayers and Businesses ” _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_color=”#ffffff” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text admin_label=”Text” _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ text_orientation=”center” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415%22:%91%22text_text_color%22%93}”]

Natural disasters strike with little or no warning. Here are some actions you can take now that’ll have you better positioned should you or your business be affected by a disaster.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ admin_label=”Row 2″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Electronic Recordkeeping” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||400″ icon_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ image_icon_width=”40px” admin_label=”Blurb: Electronic Recordkeeping” _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_font=”|||on|||||” header_text_align=”center” header_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ header_font_size=”18px” body_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ background_enable_color=”off” text_orientation=”center” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415%22:%91%22header_text_color%22,%22body_text_color%22,%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Utilize paperless methods by scanning important documents like tax returns and W-2s, and storing them securely in digital formats. Regularly back up these files and keep copies in separate, safe locations.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Documenting Valuables” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ image_icon_width=”40px” admin_label=”Blurb: Documenting Valuables” _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_font=”|||on|||||” header_text_align=”center” header_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ header_font_size=”18px” body_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ body_link_font=”|600|||on||||dotted” body_link_text_color=”#FFFFFF” background_enable_color=”off” text_orientation=”center” custom_css_main_element=”text-underline-offset: 4px;” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415%22:%91%22header_text_color%22,%22body_text_color%22,%22icon_color%22%93}”]

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ admin_label=”Row 3″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Emergency Planning” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||divi||400″ icon_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ image_icon_width=”40px” admin_label=”Blurb: Emergency Planning” _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_font=”|||on|||||” header_text_align=”center” header_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ header_font_size=”18px” body_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ background_enable_color=”off” text_orientation=”center” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415%22:%91%22header_text_color%22,%22body_text_color%22,%22icon_color%22%93}”]Develop and annually update emergency plans, considering changes in personal or business circumstances. Ensure plans include communication strategies and data backup procedures.[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Fiduciary Bonds” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ image_icon_width=”40px” admin_label=”Blurb: Fiduciary Bonds” _builder_version=”4.27.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_font=”|||on|||||” header_text_align=”center” header_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ header_font_size=”18px” body_text_color=”gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415″ background_enable_color=”off” text_orientation=”center” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-5a100212-1cec-4a0c-a7e8-f296dae24415%22:%91%22header_text_color%22,%22body_text_color%22,%22icon_color%22%93}”]
